King Xerxes required that all the people in his empire pay taxes. Even the people who lived on the islands
(OR, in coastal areas) were required to pay taxes.
And all the great and powerful things that Xerxes did were written in the scroll called/entitled ‘The record of the things done by the kings of Media and Persia’. In this book were also written
by Mordecai, the man whom the king had greatly honored.
Mordecai, who was a Jew, became the king’s most important official, and
the Jews also considered him to be a very great man. They
respected him, because he did many good things for the Jews, and he often asked
to do good things for them.
